messageBody:
Brian Button <bbutton01@...> writes:

> My problem is that I designed a Java GUI using TfD, and now I want
> to run these unit tests, along with the rest of my tests, during my
> nightly build. I'm building on a Unix machine, which means that the
> java ui has to connect to an X server somewhere. If it doesn't, then
> all the gui-related tests fail, since they can't open their windows.

The Pure Java AWT libraries at

http://www.eteks.com/pja/en/

allow you to run AWT apps on UNIX without X. I've used them when
generating graphics with server-side web apps and observed no
difference between these and an X server. They're probably too slow
for interactive use, but for your purposes they should do fine. GPL,
too, if you care.

Hope this helps,

JLM
